description:
An oddball new app called Palmsy lets you post to a social media network full of adoring followers who only exist in your imagination. Whether used as a journaling app with a fresh twist or a nicotine patch equivalent for social media addiction, Palmsy prevents the real world from ever seeing your ‚Äúposts,‚Äù storing them on-device, offline and private.

Palmsy‚Äôs App Store description says it ‚Äúlets you make little posts for yourself.‚Äù And, at its core, that‚Äôs all you‚Äôre doing. As for why you‚Äôd want to do such a thing, people who have trouble with typical journaling or mind-mapping apps may find it a more inspiring framework. Or, if your social posting habit has gotten out of hand (or you want a break from it for any other reason), it could serve as a way to wea
title: Journaling app Palmsy offers fake likes from real friends

description:
Instagram is working on a feature that would recommend Reels to you and a friend based on videos you've shared with each other and your individual interests. Reverse engineer Alessandro Paluzzi unearthed the feature, which is called Blend. Instagram confirmed to TechCrunch that it's testing Blend internally and it hasn't started trialing it publicly. It may be the case that Blend never sees the light of day, though it's always intriguing to find out about the ideas Instagram is toying with.

The platform hasn't revealed more details about how Blend will work, though the idea seems to be that Instagram users and one of their besti
title: Instagram is working on new Reels feed that combines two users' interests

description:
OpenAI just announced that it recently conducted a small-scale preview of a new tool called Voice Engine. This is a voice cloning technology that can mimic any speaker by analyzing a 15-second audio sample. The company says it generates ‚Äúnatural-sounding speech‚Äù with ‚Äúemotive and realistic voices.‚Äù

The technology is based on the company‚Äôs pre-existing text-to-speech API and it has been in the works since 2022. OpenAI has already been using a version of the toolset to power the preset voices available in the current text-to-speech API and the Read Aloud feature. There are a bunch of samples on the company‚Äôs official blog and they sound eerily close to the real thing. I encourage you to give them a listen and imagine the possibilities
title: OpenAI says it can clone a voice from just 15 seconds of audio

description:
X is working on features that will allow admins of ‚ÄúCommunities,‚Äù the platform‚Äôs tool for subreddit-like groups, to designate the spaces as containing ‚Äúadult content.‚Äù The change was confirmed by an engineer at X amid reports that the Elon Musk-owned company was working on enabling NSFW groups.

In a post on X, engineer Dong Wook Chung noted that ‚Äúsoon‚Äù NSFW content would be automatically filtered in the app‚Äôs Communities feature. ‚ÄúAdmins can now set 'Adult content' in Settings to avoid auto-filtering of the content,‚Äù Chung said.

As Bloomberg
title: X is working on NSFW Communities for adult content

description:
Gig work predates the internet. Besides traditional forms of self-employment, like plumbing, offers for ad-hoc services have long been found in the Yellow Pages and newspaper classified ads, and later Craigslist and Backpage which supplanted them. Low-cost broadband internet allowed for the proliferation of computer-based gig platforms like Mechanical Turk, Fiverr and Elance, which offered just about anyone some extra pocket change. But once smartphones took off, everywhere could be an office, and everything could be a gig ‚Äî and thus the gig economy was born.

Maybe it was a confluence of technological advancement and broad financial anxiety from the 2008 recession, but prospects were bad, people needed money and many had no freedom to be picky about how. This was the same era in which the phrase "the sharing economy" proliferated ‚Äî at once sold as an antidote to overconsumption, but that freedom
title: How Uber and the gig economy changed the way we live and work

description: Amazon's Big Spring Sale ended earlier this week, but a handful of the better tech discounts we saw during the event are still kicking. We've also found a few new deals of note, including all-time lows on the newest MacBook Air, the best price to date for an
title: Apple's MacBook Air M3 hits an all-time low, plus the rest of the week's best tech deals

description: I had a favorite version of Mulan growing up (Anita Yuen in the 1998 Taiwanese TV series). I obsessed over Chinese period TV series like Legend of the Condor Heroes, My Fair Princess and The Book and the Sword. I consider myself fairly well-versed in Chinese historical figures, especially those represented in ‚Äò90s and 2000s entertainment in Asia. So when I found out that a UK-based studio had made a VR game called The Pirate Quee
title: The Pirate Queen interview: How Singer Studios and Lucy Liu brought forgotten history to life

description:
Last year, Polestar announced its most practical EV yet in the Polestar 4. But this week, during the vehicle‚Äôs North American debut at the New York International Auto Show, we finally got an official launch price and a chance to check out its most controversial feature.

Positioned as a slightly smaller and more affordable version of the Polestar 3, the company's latest EV SUV has a lot riding on it as it looks to be Polestar's most appealing mainstream offering to date. The good news is that while the cost was initially said to be around $60,000, launch pricing actually comes in slightly below that. The Polestar 4 starts at $56,300 (including destination) for the standard long-range single-motor version with around 300 miles of range while th
title: Polestar 4 first look: When no rear window makes for a better car

description:
In 2014, WIRED asked me to write a few lines about my most-used app as part of an internship application. I wrote about WhatsApp because it was a no-brainer. I was an international student from India, and it was my lifeline to my family and to my girlfriend, now my wife, who lived on the other side of the world. ‚ÄúThis cross-platform messenger gets all the credit for my long-distance relationship of two years, which is still going strong,‚Äù I wrote in my application. ‚ÄúSkype is great, Google+ Hangouts are the best thing to have happened since Gmail but nothing says ‚ÄòI love you‚Äô like a WhatsApp text message.‚Äù

A few months into that internship, Facebook announced it was buying WhatsApp for a staggering $19 billion. In WIRED‚Äôs newsroom, there were audible gasps at this seemingly minor player's price tag. American journalists weren‚Äôt exactly unfamiliar with WhatsApp. Much of the country was still locked in a battle between green and blue bubbles, e
title: How WhatsApp became the world‚Äôs default communication app

description:
This week, it‚Äôs all about cars and Lucy Liu in VR. Devindra chats with Senior Writer Sam Rutherford about his visit to the New York International Auto Show, where he saw the Polestar 4, a unique new EV without a rear window. Also, Cherlynn pops in to chat with Lucy Liu about her new VR game, The Pirate Queen. We also explore the issues around Florida‚Äôs bill banning young kids from social media sites, and Sam tells us why he likes Netflix‚Äôs Avatar: The Last Airbender adaptation.

Listen below or subscribe on your podcast app of choice. If you've got suggestions or topics you'd like covered on the show, be sure to email us or drop a note in the comments! And be sure to check out our other podcast, Engadget News!
title: Engadget Podcast: The NY Auto Show and a chat with Lucy Liu

description:
Elon Musk's answer to ChatGPT is getting an update to make it better at math, coding and more. Musk's xAI has launched Grok-1.5 to early testers with "improved capabilities and reasoning" and the ability to process longer contexts. The company claims it now stacks up against GPT-4, Gemini Pro 1.5 and Claude 3 Opus in several areas. 

Going by xAI's numbers, Grok-1.5 appears to be a large improvement over Grok-1. It shot up to 50.6 percent in the MATH benchmark, over double the previous score. It also climbed to 90 percent and 74.1 percent in GSM8K (math word problems) and HumanEval (coding), respectively, compared to 62.9 percent and 63.2 percent before. Tho
title: Elon Musk's updated Grok AI claims to be better at coding and math

description:
Activision is reportedly in the midst of investigating a hacking campaign that's stealing login credentials from people playing its games. According to TechCrunch, bad actors have been successfully installing malware onto victims' computers and using their access to steal logins for their gaming accounts and even their crypto wallets. The video game publisher has apparently been helping victims remove the malware and regain control of their accounts, but it doesn't have enough information at the moment to say how the malware is spreading. 

TechCrunch's source said the malware "could be only affecting folks who have third-party tools installed," insinuating that people are getting it from non-Activision-de
title: Activision is reportedly looking into the malware stealing its users' login credentials

description:
The major players in live TV streaming are YouTube TV, Hulu + Live TV, FuboTV, Sling and DirecTV Stream, with Philo rounding things out as a good budget option. Each one purports to replicate cable with vast channel offerings, local news, sports and linear programming ‚Äî and most services promise to be cheaper than cable, too. That‚Äôs true in some cases, but depending on which and how many add-ons and packages you get in addition to the base service, it can also end up being far more expensive than basic cable. To help you get the most bang for your buck, we break down just what live TV services offer and suggest the best ones for different viewers.

What to look for in a live TV streaming service

How to stream live TV

Streaming live TV is a lot like using Netflix. You get access through apps on your phone, tablet, smart TV or streaming device and th
title: The best live TV streaming services to cut cable in 2024
